clause.title: Acceptable forms of construction for floors — timber

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Acceptable forms of construction for timber floors are set out in (2) and (3).

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: 19 mm thick particleboard floor sheeting with—

ol.li: 190 mm x 45 mm timber joists at 450 mm centres; and
R2.5 glass or mineral wool insulation positioned between timber joists; and

28 mm metal furring channels and isolation mounts fixed to underside of joists, isolation mounts to be of natural rubber with a dynamic factor of not more than 1.1 and static deflection of not less than 3 mm at actual operating load; and
two layers of 16 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard fixed to furring channels,

subclause.p: has an Rw + Ctr of not less than 50, an Ln,w of not more than 62 and an Rw of not less than 50, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C10a.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Timber flooring with minimum 8.5 kg/m² mass, over 19 mm thick particleboard floor sheeting with—

ol.li: 190 mm x 45 mm timber joists at not less than 450 mm centres; and
R2.5 glass or mineral wool insulation positioned between timber joists; and
28 mm metal furring channels fixed to underside of joists at 600 mm centres by clip or mount; and
one layer of 13 mm acoustic grade plasterboard fixed to furring channels,

subclause.p: has an Rw + C of not less than 45 and an Rw of not less than 45, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C10b.
